snippet: Pentagon officials fought the perception that an 8 percent increase in reported assaults in 2014 signals the military’s problem is getting worse.
abstract: Defense Secretary Chuck Hagel says 8 percent rise in reported sexual assaults in military in 2014 shows progress in encouraging victims to report sex crimes against them; points out rise in reports does not necessarily mean there has been an increase in assaults against service members as compared with 2013 figures.
lead_paragraph: Pentagon officials fought the perception that an 8 percent increase in reported assaults in 2014 signals the military’s problem is getting worse.

headline.main: Rise in Sexual Assault Reports Is a Positive, Hagel Says
headline.print_headline: Hagel Sees Progress in Reporting of Assaults

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
keywords.name: subject
